articles.title: Mammootty-Starrer ‘Bramayugam' Is a Folk Horror Parable on the Rigged Status-Quo - The Wire
articles.description: The world in Sadasivan’s primarily black-and-white film is impressively atmospheric and often teases that its commentary is more profound and novel than it is.
articles.content: Its almost always damp in the forests of South Malabar, where Rahul Sadasivans Bramayugam takes place. Set in the late 17th century, when the Portuguese have begun enslaving locals, one can see beads… [+4650 chars]
